questiontext.text: If a variable has never been assigned a value then the variable is ______________
The length of a String is returned by the _____________
If a checkbox called cb is not checked on a form which uses the POST action then $_POST['cb'] will evaluate to be _______________
str_pos("This is a test string","test"); will evaluate to ______________
intval("1")+2*intval("3"); will evaluate to ______________
(__LINE__), (__FILE__), (__DIR__), (__FUNCTION__) are all types of ______________
The concatenation operator in PHP is:
If $x contains "Hello, " and $y contains "world" and a line of code containing $x.=$y; is executed then "Hello, World" will be _______________
If $x contains 1 and $y contains 1 then $x xor $y evaluates to be _____________
If a variable is first used inside a function then it can be seen and read ______________
When something needs to be repeated a predetermined number of times the loop used should be ______________
In order to loop through each element in an array the best loop to use would be _______________
When a loop needs to execute at least once the loop to use would be _______________
An array where named keys are use to as an index to the array is called _______________
$_GET and $_POST are examples of _______________
Egyptian Brackets are a nickname for _______________
The PSR-2 Programming Standard for PHP requires the use of _______________ for if statements and loops

answer.text: A mix of K&R and Allman style brackets
Either Egyptian brackets or Allman brackets

questiontext.text: According to the PSR-1 standard Class names should be in _______________
_____________ is described as the sharing of attributes and methods among classes
In PHP, methods of a Class that start with a double underscore are referred to as _________ methods
The "arrow" operator which is identified using -> in PHP is also referred to as the _____________
Which of the following terms can be best used to replace the Inheritance Arrow Operator when describing the Inheritance relationship between two classes ____________
When using a loop to generate a dropdown list of options from an array of variables, the <option> tag needs to be output _____________

answer.text: Before the start of the loop
After the end of the loop

questiontext.text: The value which is passed by a select tag when a form is submitted is _____________

answer.text: The value that is contained within the value attribute for that option
The value that displayed to the user
The value that is contained in the name attribute for the select tag
The value that is between the <option> </option> tags

questiontext.text: A little bit of PHP code which can be included inside a file which is mostly HTML is referred to as a _____________
If a file is mostly HTML with a little bit of PHP then, in order for the file to work properly, the file extension should be ____________
The include_once command ensures that _____________

answer.text: if a script is executed again then the output/result of the previous "include_once" command will be used on the subsquent execution of the script
if a script is executed again the script that is pulled-in by the include_once command will be executed again
if a script is executed again the include_once command will be ignored
if a script is executed again an error will be generated

questiontext.text: Inheritance is implemented in php using ______________
The correct syntax used to assign a value to a class variable using the $this pseudo variable is _______________
Another term for getter methods is ______________
Three examples of magic methods in PHP are ______________

answer.text: constructor methods, getter methods and setter methods
getter methods, setter methods, toString methods

questiontext.text: It is necessary to destroy objects because _______________

answer.text: Unused objects use up memory which could be released back to the operating system
Objects need to be destroyed in order to that the values inside them can be reused
Unused objects represent a risk to the security of the system
Before a new object can be instantiated from a class the old object must first be destroyed
Unused objects become obsolete after a period of time

questiontext.text: Encapsulation in OOP is implemented by ______________

answer.text: Making the methods public and the attributes private
Making the variables public and the attributes private
Making the variables private and the atrributes public
Making the attributes public and the methods private
Making both the attributes and methods private

questiontext.text: The point of Encapsulation and Inheritance in OOP is ________________

answer.text: Ensuring no other programmer can change the way an object works
Sharing attributes and methods among classes

questiontext.text: If a programmer fails to destroy a session then ______________

answer.text: The user will receive a session not destroyed error message
The session will time out after one hour by default

questiontext.text: Normal PHP Variables which are declared on a PHP page can ______________

answer.text: Never be accessed from other pages
be accessed on other pages through use of the global() function
be accessed on other pages if they are declared outside a function or class
be accessed from other pages through the use of a Magic method

questiontext.text: To use a session, the programmer _____________

answer.text: must use the start_session(); command on every page where session variables are accessed
must use the start_session(); only when first initialising the session
must use the start_session(); command on every page in the site whether accessing session variables or not
must use the start_session(); command after every time a session has been destroyed
does not necessarily have to use the start_session(); command

questiontext.text: The time(); function returns ______________

answer.text: The total number of seconds since 1/1/1970
The time the session was started
The amount of seconds since the session was started

questiontext.text: The browser stores the session id (token) in _____________

If a Program tries to verify the time a session was last accessed by accessing the session variable which stores the last accessed time but the page has never before been accessed and therefore the session has not been started then ______________

answer.text: An undefined index error may occur
There is no problem as the session has never been accessed
The session will automatically be started
